trans-unit.source: Converts an icon to a 32 bits-per-pixel format and copies to the new icon

seg-source.mrk: Converts an icon to a 32 bits-per-pixel format and copies to the new icon

target.mrk: Converts an icon to a 32 bits-per-pixel format and copies to the new icon

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle to the icon to be converted.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the icon to be converted.

target.mrk: Handle to the icon to be converted.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether to delete the icon after the function is successful, valid values:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether to delete the icon after the function is successful, valid values:

target.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether to delete the icon after the function is successful, valid values:

trans-unit.source: True - Icon will be deleted if the function succeeds.

seg-source.mrk: True - Icon will be deleted if the function succeeds.

target.mrk: True - Icon will be deleted if the function succeeds.

trans-unit.source: False - Do not delete, you must release the icon themselves when you are finished using it (Default).

seg-source.mrk: False - Do not delete, you must release the icon themselves when you are finished using it (Default).

target.mrk: False - Do not delete, you must release the icon themselves when you are finished using it (Default).

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: Handle to the newly created icon.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the newly created icon.

target.mrk: Handle to the newly created icon.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: This function converts an icon with any color depth into an icon with 32 bits-per-pixel (RGB + Alpha) format.

seg-source.mrk: This function converts an icon with any color depth into an icon with 32 bits-per-pixel (RGB + Alpha) format.

target.mrk: This function converts an icon with any color depth into an icon with 32 bits-per-pixel (RGB + Alpha) format.

trans-unit.source: If the source icon already is a 32 bits-per-pixel icon, and has an alpha chanel, the function generates the new AND bitmask bitmap, and copies it to a new icon.

seg-source.mrk: If the source icon already is a 32 bits-per-pixel icon, and has an alpha chanel, the function generates the new AND bitmask bitmap, and copies it to a new icon.

target.mrk: If the source icon already is a 32 bits-per-pixel icon, and has an alpha chanel, the function generates the new AND bitmask bitmap, and copies it to a new icon.

trans-unit.source: If the source icon has a 32 bits-per-pixel color depth, and do not have an alpha chanel, the function creates an alpha chanel from its AND bitmask.

seg-source.mrk: If the source icon has a 32 bits-per-pixel color depth, and do not have an alpha chanel, the function creates an alpha chanel from its AND bitmask.

target.mrk: If the source icon has a 32 bits-per-pixel color depth, and do not have an alpha chanel, the function creates an alpha chanel from its AND bitmask.

trans-unit.source: If the source icon is non 32 bits-per-pixel icon, it will be converted into a 32 bits-per-pixel format with alpha chanel.

seg-source.mrk: If the source icon is non 32 bits-per-pixel icon, it will be converted into a 32 bits-per-pixel format with alpha chanel.

target.mrk: If the source icon is non 32 bits-per-pixel icon, it will be converted into a 32 bits-per-pixel format with alpha chanel.

trans-unit.source: The _WinAPI_Create32BitHICON() always creates an icon with alpha channel and AND bitmask, although it is not used to display icons that contain an alpha channel.

seg-source.mrk: The _WinAPI_Create32BitHICON() always creates an icon with alpha channel and AND bitmask, although it is not used to display icons that contain an alpha channel.

target.mrk: The _WinAPI_Create32BitHICON() always creates an icon with alpha channel and AND bitmask, although it is not used to display icons that contain an alpha channel.

trans-unit.source: Note that to display the fully transparent icons used only its AND bitmask, not the alpha channel.

seg-source.mrk: Note that to display the fully transparent icons used only its AND bitmask, not the alpha channel.

target.mrk: Note that to display the fully transparent icons used only its AND bitmask, not the alpha channel.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, its XOR and AND bitmasks will remain unchanged.

seg-source.mrk: Therefore, its XOR and AND bitmasks will remain unchanged.

target.mrk: Therefore, its XOR and AND bitmasks will remain unchanged.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished using the icon, destroy it using the _WinAPI_DestroyIcon() function.

seg-source.mrk: When you are finished using the icon, destroy it using the _WinAPI_DestroyIcon() function.

target.mrk: When you are finished using the icon, destroy it using the _WinAPI_DestroyIcon() function.
